lines.text: I know I'm only happy when I'm thinking about Toni.
Honestly, Lisl, I can't see what you see in that piano player.
Oh, I know you think he's conceited. I like conceited men. I don't like the other kind.
What other kind?

[reading a newspaper]
It says here there's a terrible famine in Tibet. And a riot in Havana.

[playing idly at the piano]
There's a riot in Havana.
Hmm. A riot in the streets.

[singing]
There's a riot in Havana...
[exclaiming]
Look! It fits!
[resumes singing]
There's a riot in Havana and a famine in Tibet...
There's a drought in Indiana...

[singing]
It won't get wet... There is fighting in the Balkans-
Oh, it doesn't say that there.
There is *always* fighting in the Balkans.
Archduke, you're a prince.

Of course, I've heard his name linked with the Hungarian countess, that the Emperor hates her family and if he knew about it he'd be furious! Then, he'd break it off, then she'd be sent back to Hungary, and, then there might be a chance for me.
Well, what would you do with Willy?
Oh, Willy's sweet and I love him, but, if the Archduke needed me, I'd have to give up love for patriotism.
Yes, we've had fun in Willy's horse cart. But, then, the Archduke's carriage wouldn't be so bad either.
Lift up your stockings!
You mean you're not going to make love to me?
Do you always choose the clothes for the Archduke's young ladies?
You'd be surprised what I have to do for the Archduke's young ladies.
Oh!
Keep with the good humor. Be gay!
I almost feel that I know you. My mother's sister-in-law has a friend, that certain Mrs. Portchester, who used to wash all the laces of your Aunt Marie's underwear.
Oh, ha-ha, they were very good friends.
This wine is funny. Right after you drink it, you feel gay and, then, quite suddenly, you feel, sort of, sleepy.
An evening alone, by myself, you see, I find it very distressing. I find I talk to myself.
Oh, that's nothing. Lots of people talk to themselves.
Yes, but, the trouble with me - is - that I'm a frightful bore.
Yes.
Women see realities more clearly than men.
We're out here to have a farewell party and I want it to be a gay one.
Did someone tell you?
When a woman knows a man, as I know you, she doesn't have to be told. There isn't a look in your eye that I don't know. There isn't a turn of your head that doesn't mean - something to me.
After you kiss me, turn around and go - and don't look back.
